page.title: 16Recreation and Leisure
page.content: Roger Edwards:- One of the most popular pastimes in East London is fishing along the canals and in the Limehouse Basin. There is still a strong interest in the traditional sport of Boxing, with major events at York Hall, Bethnal Green. Quite a few people go to the Wapping Sports Centre, opened in 1981. Office workers use it in their lunch hours. Women in particular use the Sauna and Solarium. A new sports and leisure centre at Aldgate called the Sedgewick Centre has just opened to the public, though its main use is for employees in the adjacent Sedgewick House. There is also a new leisure centre being built by the London Docklands Development Corporation on the Isle of Dogs both for local residents and for workers in the Enterprise Zone.
